u6weiphRp-sMdi4vubuP4A.text: In the world of pubs, a lot of things are the same. Usually the food is the same, and often the options to drink are the same. The location can be a differentiating factor, and the prices, and the service. And sometimes, it's just a moment in your mind that makes a pub stand out. In this case, it's the sun pouring in a window to my best friend and I, seated at a table made of long benches, tucking into a burger, fish, and chips, with a couple pints, and a breeze wafting over us. We picked the Marquis of Westminster because they were open on a Sunday, and not far from Victoria station (remember what I said about location). They had a wide menu, and good service from the young men at the bar. The prices were pretty standard, but as my friend was treating me to a "you're about to graduate!" lunch, it all worked out in the end. As well, my bezzie wanted fish and chips, and the previous reviews said they were good. We had a multi-course meal, and tried the scotch eggs, and fruit and cream dessert. All around, it was a good meal.It's a nice place to pop in, I'm sure it's a good local, as they have both indoor and outdoor seating in good weather, and they're right on the corner of two streets, which I'm sure aids when waiting for a cab. A good choice if you're in the area!

aaItJdw_MltZxl3Gel7EQQ.text: Came here with friends for a Sunday roast and the chicken was very delicious. Nice spot in Victoria to go for food and drinks with friends. Quaint, non fussy atmosphere!

OzVGIco4BaBKqTqH7z8a6w.text: Went here for a team lunch. We were able to get a seat. Service was very slow for the food to come out, we waited for an hour for the food. The burger I got was quite pricey for what it was. £12.50 for a burger and fries. That's not out of the ordinary for burgers in London. The whole burger was meh. The cheese was cold. Bacon was barely there. My colleague didn't even have a piece of bacon on his burger. When it came time for the bill, we paid for a food but when we asked for a receipt, the waitress gave way too much sass in her reply of no. I think the xmas stress got to the kitchen staff and the waitress, maybe another visit when it is less busy will be better. I will probably come back to the pub downstairs but not for the food.

8rWkaO0v-62BtM-1a96PZQ.text: Very typical British pub atmosphere. The place wasn't too packed on a Sunday at 9:00pm so we were seated right away. The guy who seemed to be the manager was running around frantically trying to take care of people while we were there but was very friendly.They were out of the burger that we ordered so had to substitute for the pulled pork sandwich which was good. The beef Sunday roast was very good. Not the absolute best that I've had but still hit the spot. Also had the sticky toffee pudding which didn't last long on our plate. Great food for the price! Would have given a higher score if we weren't seated by the server's stand but would recommend this place to others.

megSMygqRG6j_8hAavpkRw.text: Wanted something light and fresh so ordered the Thai Chicken Salad. The chicken is obviously left over from the Sunday roast and is very overly salted. There is no Thai seasoning? I think they thought adding beansprouts and a couple of peanuts makes this dish Eastern.

aX9obsHsxyEBXDfVR2Zzjw.text: This was our local pub for our stay and it was a pretty decent place.I want to give it 3.5 but yelp doesn't allow for half stars at this point.  They have a small draft selection but when you're stumbling distance from your hotel and want a few pints before bed, it's a good place.We ate here one night and the food was just ok, nothing to really write home about.  I had a vegetarian platter that had spring rolls, grilled halloumi, onion bhaji, tzatziki and hummus.  My bhaji was actually really over-cooked.  The rest of the platter was certainly tasty but not mind blowing.I think this is a great spot to grab a drink and they have quiz on Monday nights.  I signed up to be on a team and then promptly showed up at the wrong time because I'm an American idiot.I think you'll like this spot, it's definitely worth a shot.

hZFDQ1e-YjiMgFAKVteLKw.text: Really good service. It was quite busy when we stepped into the bar. But we found a couple of seats and ordered a few pints from the pull taps. We also tried one of the scotch eggs. It was cooked perfectly and tasted really good made with their black pudding.  We also shared the bacon cheese burger and a salad which were equally as good. The burger was cooked just right and the bun was toasted perfectly! It was a very lively atmosphere with the World Cup on every TV. Service was fast and everything was reasonably priced.

CyIwYRnTjPWSCHFyeV_Vzg.text: Amazing food !! Cozy atmosphere ! Beer was awesome as well! Staff really sweet and attentive. A must go to if your looking for great food! Pulled pork nachos for an app were delicious, short rib for a main course was outstanding! Highly recommend. Only reason it got 4 and not 5 stars is the price was a bit steep.

a0oddtPQEzuT45zMg4KjWw.text: I'm no fish-n-chips connoisseur, but these were the best I've ever had. Bacon cheeseburger also recommended. Good atmosphere and friendly service.

sCb_VdJQSpKUa975twV_Ag.text: I like this pub very much, its definitely the best in the area.  It can get busy on Thursdays and Fridays but the atmosphere is always good and the bar staff friendly.  The food is generally good and the they have a decent choice of wines too.  As bar snacks they do some olives stuffed with feta, pork scratchings and now rather bizarrely giant scotch eggs.The downstairs bar can be hired for events and has some nice little booths if you'd rather keep your group to itself.

mZ_60ppXRw-ykawS_J6m7w.text: Really crap fish and chips, I'd be disappointed if I got these in a cheap chipper.  Soggy batter, tasteless fish, awful tartare sauce, chips were either barely cooked or very overcooked.  It was served in a deep frying basket with the fish on top of the chips, making the whole thing really hard to eat.  Service was slow and the food took a really long time.  Avoid this place - you'd be better going to Burger King.

TPxKVRfHMNJ868BJIAGvSQ.text: Adorable neighborhood pub by Victoria station.  Good food, decent service.  Try their Scottish egg, it's worth a spin. Affordable beers....

J7FB2v1m0izrgP3wMp22sg.text: First night in London - I was exhausted - the service was friendly and understanding, the food was very good, great ale recommendation and a good price. Absolutely nothing wrong with this place, it is a charming spot if you are in the area!

fZVivodw__HKSIz5LgDlew.text: What a fab little restaurant! Great for pre theatre dinner and bevvies!  Had the fish and chips and a DoomBar ale. Very tasty and would definately go again.

RA7MpSNpEaJu6ZryikmbTQ.text: cool little pub.  Friendly service.  Busy but not too crowded.  Such a diverse group.  Everyone from the seniors to the grungy with a dash of yuppie.  Good fun, but they close early.... : (   Last call by 1130pm?  Oh well, I needed to get up early the next day anyway.

M1WKb_IrV0WYe78X_fWxXA.text: Feels more like a local pub than a tourist hot spot. We stayed at a hotel just a few doors over from the Marquis and went here a few times. I thought it was a wonderful pub and although we didn't eat here we saw lots of people who were and the food smelled wonderful. The service was great and we noticed it seems to be more of a local pub than a tourist one. Most of the people who walked through the door seemed to know everyone sitting at the bar and working behind it. We tried to go in here 2 of the nights we were here but there were just too many people you could barely move, which is usually the sign of a good pub in my books. Also, Thursday nights seem to be the busiest for pubs in London so if you want to get a seat here, go early! All in all it's a great lil pub and I would def go here again.

FMZlTNEEcBkHFud9-58lPQ.text: Good fish and chips. Decent service. Stay away from the meat dish; it's not that great.

tSD_LgWEVHSemdLOSd1POw.text: Cool gastro pub, good staff, great atmosphere. Going back for sure!

AN0zQUmVLbr1TXgGn07UMw.text: We are Pimlico locals and it has to be said that The Marquis of Westminster is the best pub in the area. It shut for a refurb over xmas and re-opened at the beginning of February. There is a now gastro-pub restaurant upstairs as well as the usual bar on the ground floor. We have been to eat 3 times since it has re-opened and it was fantastic every time. We can thoroughly recommend the food form both the restaurant and the bar menus. Great fish and chips and one of the best burgers in London! The Sunday roast was excellent too and puddings and scotch eggs were equally delicious. The bar staff are always very friendly and the service is always great. There is always a good choice of well kept cask ale as well as the premium lagers you'd expect. If you are staying in the area or trying to find somewhere to eat or drink in Pimlico, look no further than the Marquis of Westminster!

oB4b91A7S_D29f5cZ0TxKg.text: Great neighborhood pub with friendly staff.  The food is not too bad either.

oDTMAG-QKfT_khD3lqFp9Q.text: This is a brunch review, so if you're wanting detailed analysis of the Sunday roast or the guest ales, you'll have to wait. I came for the brunch and now I'm going to review it.The reason we went to The Marquis for brunch (it's not exactly your standard brunch location as it's very pubby) is because we had the dogs and wanted to sit outside. It was about 12 on a Sunday and it was eerily quiet, I think there were only 3 or 4 other diners in the restaurant. But the bar staff were very friendly, said we could have the dogs inside (which we didn't do, because it was relatively warm) and dealt with our orders pretty quickly. They also have newspapers to read, which I think is always a nice (and very easy) touch.For me, the biggest appeal of The Marquis were the prices. My pancakes and bacon were only £5.90, which is great value for the area, and my girlfriend's avocado and halloumi wrap was £5.25. Neither of these dishes were perfect - the wrap was a little small and my pancakes could've used extra maple syrup - but they were both good (the pancakes were very fluffy, full marks there) and great value. I also had a decent coffee, though, as a coffee snob, I probably wouldn't go there just for the coffee.Brunch is a holistic experience. Some people really hype brunch places where you're expected to queue for an hour just to get a table, and that's really not for me. So I give The Marquis plus points for being quiet, friendly and amenable to my canine companions. The prices make it an appealing venue for a casual, unshowy brunch (I probably wouldn't invite friends to the area specifically to brunch there) and it would be flirting with 5-stars for me if they'd given me a hearty pot of maple syrup on the side!

UIM6vejkexVWDQ_HYgInEQ.text: Review is on the dining room, not the pub portion. We were starving after flying in from overseas and just wanted some good food. The pub downstairs was alive & overcrowded so we headed upstairs to the dining room. It's small, being up the winding stairs from the main bar but quiet and enjoyable. The ladies taking care of the room were helpful & nice, quick to answer questions & bring drinks & food. There's a small bar up there so drinks will be up shortly. The fish & chips were tasty; fresh tasting, fried crisp but not rubbery. All in all a good pub dining experience.

Qt1qzImiBm3HD015meYl9A.text: I appreciate that the owner took time to reply to my review and offer some compensation (though I won't accept).   As a business owner myself, I understand the effort it takes to satisfy the customer.  Things don't always go well, so his gesture is welcomed.  Perhaps, our dining experience that night was not the norm.  I wish the restaurant well.

56tT4VtzeQ1gPd1FqbaOow.text: I have really appreciate this pub. I had dinner with a vegetable soup that was very tasty. Maybe a little spicy but very tasty!Moreover the service was awesome and the guys are cool (and a bit beautiful ahaha)This place is super and beer is very good too!Hope to have dinner/lunch here once again!

-H_nsUhcK5G3C6aukkOaEw.text: Pimms was way too sweet. Udon noodles drenched in salty, syrupy sauce. Ordered Gimlet but got G&T. Waitress made us feel like we were a burden. Many beers, but none listed on menu. Known for their gin, but only one on menu. I never give bad reviews because I respect and appreciate the hospitality industry, but this place disappointed at every turn. Maybe, just maybe they didn't like that we were Americans. Sad.

UFn1teUSlU_VIsuvKVE0mQ.text: I came for dinner and ended up upstairs, where it was quieter and much less pub-esque. I love pubs so this was a bit of a disappointment, but so be it. The whole place, downstairs and up, was absolutely packed around 8pm on a Tuesday. Our service was friendly but not amazing. Food did come quick.My wife and I each got fish and chips, and it was good. None of it was amazing, but was all tasty, and the portions were good. The English ale list is pretty small, only three choices, which was disappointing. However, they were fine choices.I would return, but would want to be downstairs by the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips

omNZ4w-CiQ2Hgd4GZNBIuA.text: Lovely little pub. Thanks to Yelp we were able to find this place for my starving boyfriend. We both had burgers and they did not disappoint. Excellent, meaty, thick and tasty indeed. Beer was fine also. Sunny, warm, and welcoming place in the mid-afternoon. I would go back again if I'm in the area. Pimlico is a cute little place.One weird thing though: the staff and the other patrons were all foreign. There was not a Birtish person in the place. I guess that's perfectly normal in London, but it made the whole experience seem a bit contrived. I was hoping for a more homey feel but since it was my first hour in London I probably had my hopes too high. Still, our Canadian waitress was adorable.Maybe it's all the good reviews attracting people from abroad. Anyway I'd have preferred to go somewhere more "local," if such a place exists in that area.

PFr85EmYNJMh7Q87ebZ8Kg.text: It is good typical English pub food.  We liked the upstairs with the windows open on a surprisingly hot day.  Very pleasant for a family of four.

8fvqktjdYB1pZA1ipQTs6A.text: Cute little pub/restaurant in Victoria. The service was very welcoming and the selections are plenty. We enjoyed the bar area one night and the restaurant (which is upstairs) a couple days later before going to the opera. I've got to say the prices are very reasonable and you get a lot of food. We ordered the daily special burger (with lots of topping options) and the watermelon haloomi salad. I'd recommend both. Pop in there if you're in the area and enjoy the company!

1TfUfUssS2azJ6QVB9RMdQ.text: This place is not quite as close to Victoria Station as some reviews led me to believe, maybe a 10 minute walk which is a little tough if you have bags.  However, the food and the service and the beer were all worth it.  The guys working the pub were very friendly and helped my friend and I stow our luggage.  The food was very good and reasonable and they had several beer and wine choices as well as a full bar.  Very good find on our way out to Gatwick.

OqujRrJTd_HLCOg4eXX1Lw.text: Great spot we found accidentally while roaming about. The food was delicious.  I ordered the chicken. The drinks were excellent and the environment was fun.  Not too loud yet, not dreary either.  The staff were friendly and helpful in their tips of places to take our visiting guests.

hlKPdGyITI35s5ywiARW4w.text: This restaurant & pub is probably gonna go largely unnoticed in both the TripAdvisor and mainstream of good London food. They had a sign that they were open from 9am for breakfast. I was staying nearby, a few blocks from Victor Station. So I wanted to get up and check this one out. I get in and it's entirely a nice British Pub atmosphere. There were only a few people there, so they were eager to get me in for some good grub. Ordered the full breakfast special for about £8. Turns out that was a great value for the portions I got. Breakfast here is a must for anyone! It was so delicious that I rewarded them by having a beer with it, just for some extra business. Looks like quite the place again when walking by later in the day. The pub is packed, they got music, and everyone seems to be enjoying themselves. I'd grab another beer, but I was off and running to the next European destination.Check out their breakfast special!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Outside the pub

qAATsNuqEkuSM0fFtriJ8w.text: Lovely newly refurbished restaurant upstairs. Great atmosphere, food and service. Fantastic spot for a pre-Wicked meal as it is close to Apollo Theater. Would have loved to have gone back post show.

LhLlZw2aOMK_KfQivkfKgw.text: Friendly service and a nice crowd on a Sunday afternoon. I went with a traditional fish & chips for my order. The chips were perfect. Crisp on the outside, soft and piping hot on the inside. The peas were seasoned perfectly. The fish....well that was OK at best. Crispy in parts, equally soggy in others. The taste of the batter was very nice too-- I'm thinking I just got the random bad order. Abundance of seating on the second floor - if it's available, grab a table overlooking the street.B-

G7T0iVxZyV1Mfrcn0-3UOg.text: Stopped in for some food and beer around 9pm, many things ran out, not a big deal the options on the menu look good.Best thing: Crayfish salad with fennel and apple. So delightful with lots of crayfish.Black pudding scotch eggs was pretty good.Cheeseburger sliders are so incredibly dry and salty... would not recommend.Asked the bartender to recommend a dark beer, he gave me a pale ale saying I should try it "it's you!", but man it was bad.There are many other options in the neighborhood, will probably try somewhere else next time!

GLi5e1VwSFjls2oMFbrw8w.text: Friendly and quick service -- came here to watch a match on tv and despite the crowds the folks behind the bar were all smiles and quick to fill my order

BFld0vduyKI1r6U4EAvD8Q.text: Join the Club ClubIt is well known that I can often be found sitting at a bar, sobbing into a handful of rubbish bread filled with bacon, chicken and some form of egg and old salad. Many years I have travelled the globe, and many times I have found myself getting hunger pains after too much walking and not enough eating. The  remedy for this ailment is always preferably a Club Sandwich and a pint of something cold, while enjoying being invisible among the local populace. All too many times have I been let down by the initial excitement of a lively, and friendly, welcome to a lovely slice of local life, to receive a substandard cold soggy tasteless Club Sandwich.But not here I tell you. These guys know how to make a club sandwich, in fact they made it so damn near perfect that I even ate the crusts! Now I like some fresh chicken, preferably warm, and for my bacon to be crunchy, check and check. I like fresh salad, but not too much of it, check again. I also like lashings of mayo, 3 slices of lightly toasted bread, AND I like a freshly prepared egg (fried or boiled), check, check, and mother flipping check. These guys ticked all the sandwich requirements, bar one, I like mine cut into 4 triangles, not 2, but if it is made correctly it should be easy to dissect once more yourself!!! I like to dip the corners into ketchup without everything falling out, I'm just telling you that this was also possible! While we are discussing a list of things I like, I also like skinny chips, I hate stupid chunky ones, I like them to be so skinny that they flip and flop around while you smother them in mayo. Would you be surprised if I told you that they also served me skinny chips, no I don't think you would, because I said earlier that this was DAMN NEAR PERFECT!Some decent banter form the friendly guys behind the bar, a pint of Timothy Taylor's Landlord to wash it down, and I skipped out of that place like the King of Clubs (I don't think he skips, but if he did,  he would look like me at that moment).

QE7KLXIdKSdbibdZitY5HA.text: Good selection of real ales on tap. Doom Bar and Sussex Best Bitter ordered. Small bar area, wooden floors, pleasant atmosphere with quiet music. Restaurant upstairs not tried out

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Bar area

Q9br-B-7mzcN4g7aG12m7w.text: One of the best burgers I've had in London. Amazing fish and chips, really nice sticky toffee pudding - and all of this in a cute room right above the pub. Really lovely for drinks if you're in the area  and for any sort of traditional pub food you're craving. For both quality and price, a nice surprise in this area of the city!

l3jBH8-78jY8sv6humB85Q.text: Best burger in the neighborhood. Service is great. They also offer Sunday roast. Charming atmosphere. The upstairs dining room was not packed on a Sunday evening. The pub was pretty busy but not overly packed. I would come back here and recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Best burger in the neighborhood

pU9GTN5eqvMn1KgwLGVisQ.text: Went here with my family one 1st night in London. We all got different versions of the pot roast; beef, lamb and duck. All were good but nothing special. Atmosphere was cool and service was good. Prices were reasonable.

lBZ4AMYyptKWW0cAnbaOGg.text: I had high expectations for this place due to the 4/5 star ratings given for this restaurant, however, my family and I did not have quite the same 5 star experience. Walking past this place on our way to the hotel, the day before coming here, we noticed people outside enjoying happy hour and just thought it would be a wonderful place to have dinner while in London. For starters I'll give feedback on what was good-the staff was uber friendly, checked in twice for drink orders and gave us enough time to order food. The music they played in the background was also really great, popular 80's hits which I personally really enjoyed. The seating area upstairs was large enough for small groups of about 3-6 people, also very cozy and comfortable. As for food, we ordered the cajun chicken nachos which had great flavor and were just the right temperature. The only issue with them was that the cheese to chip ratio was very off, way too many chips and not enough cheese to cover them. I had the mac and cheese due to popularity and the fact that they were out of fish and chips by the time we came. The mac and cheese was very good, super creamy with loads of flavor, and piping hot which is probably the most important thing when it comes to a good meal. My cousin Marley had the sausage and mash which she raved about being fantastic. As for our experience at The Marquis, this is all I could say met our standards. On the other hand, I'm giving this restaurant a 2/5 stars because of quite a few issues we experienced during our meal. The service is quite slow here, way slower than expected due to the amount of people upstairs eating. There were about 4 other couples when we came and by the time our food was served (about an hour after being seated), there was only one other couple left which I think is unacceptable. The lighting is very dim, so dim we actually had trouble reading the menus. The staff also wasn't very attentive as the night lured on, they didn't check up on us and took about 30 minutes for them to bring us dessert (which was sticky toffee pudding and unfortunately quite cold). My father had the Marquis English pie for dinner which he described as "very burnt and dry but tons of flavor." Overall he said that it could be better and that they didn't care enough to check and see if it was ok to serve. Toward the end of our meal when we were waiting for the check to come, the waitresses seemed to be less interested in the customers and more interested in their own conversations which I found to be a poor service tactic. Overall, honestly I was expecting a lot and was quite disappointed. However, we may have just came on a bad night but I'm still sure I wouldn't particularity recommend this place to friends.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Delicious cajun chicken nachos
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Marquis English pie, comes with a fried egg on top.
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Classic English bangers and mash.

zCca9iPw7qiZ6XK6Jmqjmg.text: Great food and good atmosphere. Sunday lunch is delicious and perfect place for casual meetings.

7ChQuguiuXYy0kUHxrtMtg.text: I'm 100% sold this was the BEST dining experience I've had in England. The server was not only beautiful but very courteous and helpful. She made 3 recommendations and hit home on all three. I tried the venison burger it was the BOMB also had fish and chips and the onion rings all PERFECTO. I also had 3 different beers Adnams Dry hopped beer Very good! San Miguel was equally delish and finished up with another one of her recommendations an English IPA which was also great.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Venison burger is life
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Bacon cheeseburger

qnKAXf65XeQNzHGxViRTEQ.text: I've been to some lovely pubs and given a few 5 star ratings but this place definitely deserve it!They made us feel really welcome and went out of their way to fit us in on a busy London Marathon Sunday.The beef roast was excellent, I can't fault any part of it. Pink beef, massive Yorkshire pud, crispy roast potatoes, nice stuffing and perfectly cooked veg.It was topped off by a delicious sticky toffee pudding. Another person on our table had the Jaffa cake and jammy dodger doughnuts.... Crazy good!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Beef Sunday roast with lovely pink beef and an awesome Yorkshire pud :)
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Delicious sticky toffee pudding

l6JiIhNX8Qx6KIFf0srOVQ.text: Great conversation with bartender when he finally had time.   Fish and chip dinner was decent, not the best by far.   Didn't like that I had to go to bar to order my meal since he was too busy chatting with a regular.  Chips are ok.  Not triple done at all, but still good.

-5KQAeOLTwKZotXIpw2Psg.text: I enjoyed a great, casual solo meal here tonight (business trip starts tomorrow). Details on the experience:- I looked at the menu online before I walked over (an easy 5 mins from my hotel) and worried that I might have an issue without a reservation since the menu looked great!- I decided to sit on the bar level inside (there were signs for the restaurant upstairs and also a cute outdoor area outside of the bar which I was surprised people were sitting in... maybe they were there since it was a rare evening without rain!)- A very friendly (and good-looking) waiter greeted me when I arrived and helped me choose a glass of wine to start with (less than £6)- I chose the smoked eel appetizer (£6) which was large and really delicious and the soup of the day (£4.50) which included bacon, potato, and something like sauerkraut. This was also great! - I enjoyed the people-watching as everyone seemed cheerful and happy with their foodI'm very pleased with my less than £16 meal with wine and I plan to come back this trip or on another trip soon!

YOQ_6QU48vdTdX7-PyezfQ.text: This place has a great ambiance for sure. My husband and son loved their dish, but my salad was nothing special. Pretty much romaine lettuce, an egg and a few bits of avocado. What happened to the homemade croutons? Absent. I was also not thrilled with the service. They were nice enough, but it seemed like everyone got their order taken first, etc. I've not had this experience in London before. I won't go here again.

5s8aXR65KE2_zYhyO-lTOw.text: This was the first place I went to in London and it was conveniently located across the street from my hotel room. I walked in with my boyfriend and we were welcomed right away. The people who work here are so nice and make you feel right at home. It's a super chill spot and just the place we needed to be after a long day of traveling. I highly recommend coming here if you want some good beer and food. It's super authentic and I can't express anymore how great the staff is.VERY well deserving of 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Pulled pork sliders & chicken wings

jQ-IxnRRIlzV46AOjafFAg.text: Had a round of ale and really enjoyed everything. Good selection of English ale, though my boyfriend commented that beers are a bit on the pricey side. Ambience was chill and fun -- typical neighbourhood pub kind of place. Service was very good. We had a waitress come by every once in a while to take our orders as needed. Would definitely go back and would love to try their food next time!

yEFhxFL4sg2srXTSndt1RA.text: Traveling here from Los Angeles. Found this cool place near our hotel and stopped in for lunch and a couple of beers.  We received a nice warm welcome. The place is a typical local, cozy pub. We ordered fish and chips, chicken sandwich (lunch special), sausage and mash, bacon cheese burger and chili cheese fries w-pulled pork.  Everything was excellent!!  Everyone was ranting and raving how good their meals were.  I would highly recommend coming here for some great pub food and drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Chili cheese fries.
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Onion rings, chicken sandwich and sausage and mash
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips, chili cheese fries and bacon cheese burger

IEYkGsIWmm42EB44vbEBLg.text: Pretty good as far as British pubs are concerned! The menu is pretty predictable, but they had a few options that were a bit different. The service was also quite good.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Fish finger sandwich

nUpe9l-rk9HWuhPPMYN28Q.text: Had Sunday Roast here with beef and it was delicious! Home cooking done right here! Bar is downstairs and restaurant is upstairs, but you can get the food at the bar too.

ry7Kk3DN6gTz44MUWjTeLQ.text: When I was walking through the rain I drag my suitcase passed this place on the way to my hotel and took a look on yelp and it had some good reviewsI must say the waitress was terrific great service and very friendly. I got the onion rings which are not pictured which were very nice about, tasty batter not too greasyDecided to add more fried food and not the fission chips which is very nice I've never been a big time fission chips person but the quality was amazing the batter/flakiness of the fish and the chips were very nice to

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Very nice fish and chips,
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. A peek at the menu

svFlkHElq8-XL0oJmaBzwQ.text: Nice neighborhood pub with good service and a nice selection of beers. I didn't eat but my wife had a vegetable soup (minestrone or similar) and was very pleased with it. The waitress was very pleasant.

saJomJYRbgp_9ZQN39jzyA.text: A nice looking, yet "traditional" style pub a short walk from Victoria station.It's pretty small inside, with very limited seating and standing room. On the Friday evening we visited it was full, and even hanging around the bar area wasn't an option as it blocked others from ordering drinks.There was an excellent selection of hand pumped ales, as well as mainstream (like San Miguel) and craft lagers on tap.Despite the number of people, service was quick and efficient.I wouldn't go out of my way to visit, but it's a great meeting place if you all can get to Victoria station, or if you work in the area.

yGZPSYYddAcTnh6YHTGM5w.text: Disappointed in the food, udon noodle dish almost inedibly salty and lacked any finesse of flavor. Avocado salad ok but dressing basically mayonnaise. Atmosphere good, waitress really friendly.

YIkXVLpdXvZi36uh_v69Rg.text: Great beer. Delicious fish and chips. Wonderful service. I would definitely recommend going here. I ate in the upstairs dining area, not the pub. It was less crowded and more quiet upstairs.

5yKOJzEYcBV4e-5SY5CLOQ.text: Fish and chips tasted so delicious, especially the tart sauce was great.  The waitress were really friendly.  I also had fish sandwiches (5.99ponds), but fish and chips were much better.  Come and try it!

LJpDvxJ0mgUHI5uneJ8ozQ.text: Food and drink were delicious and staff was extremely accommodating! 5 STARS! THANK YOU FOR A GREAT EVENING!

G8BFsCJxS_hghBt3xRX-Ag.text: This was right down the street from our hotel. What a terrific place. The restaurant was up the wooden spiral staircase. The view was good on a hot London day. Our server was personable and attentive. I had the wings. They come without sauce and are more the BW3's size. I had the bubble and squeak, basically a vegetable pancake and the cauliflower cheese croquet. All of it was wonderful. The rest of the group had the burger, scotch egg and vegetable dip which were great. If you can eat here you should. There is a pub on the first floor if you are looking for a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom

l1vi03usWuVVQG4GeOQQvA.text: Great food! Tasty but pricy. Servings a bit small for the price. But tasty. I think the ambience was pretty cool, and it's placed in a great area. I enjoyed the food, the setting, and most importantly the company!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Scotch eggs

No06Nxw9cPTZcsV1hvS4Og.text: This place was point with its Fish and chips , it had great taste and a good portion . Atmosphere was cozy and unique . Unfortunately this places lacked beer options for being consider a pub/tavern and it's the main reason it got 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips on point !!

c4P8oxA6KB7qVYJtKsMU5Q.text: The Marquis is fantastic! Our hotel was about a minute walk from from here and we'd come hang out before turning in almost every night. Drinks were decently priced and the food was soooo good. The staff was also super friendly, which is always a guarantee to keep people coming back.

eXT69NFBCdSYLdS093IEAw.text: This was a lovely little pub we found in Westminster, situated on a corner, it was bustling on a Saturday night. Downstairs was mainly standing area with locals and newcomers alike drinking a pint and enjoying the Christmas merriment. For sit-down meals we had to head upstairs to the dining area. Upstairs was moonlit and inviting. The coziness was lovely, looking out the large Victorian windows at the cold winter night was almost idyllic. We ordered a couple of beers, Old Speckled Hen and Peroni. Very different but good all the same. My mister was insistent on ordering the whitebait to start. I'm not a fan of fishiness but being in London, I supposed it was more about doing as in Rome, so we ordered them. As I expected, they weren't for me, but mister liked them, they were lightly fried and ample of them. For dinner I had the lentil soup with bread, and my mister the fish and chips. All very good but not exactly showstoppers. I chose soup to save room for desert, which I ordered the pear, ginger and rhubarb crumble with clotted cream. Ah it was delicious, regardless of not tasting any ginger in it. It was exactly what I was waiting for. Hot and homey, it was yummy and a typical British winter dessert to top off a lovely evening out in Westminster.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Whitebait

8C5z6Plx6sMh-dfVlVtQoQ.text: The staff was friendly, the lunch was phenomenal in it's balance of flavors. We had the winter pie, poutine and lamb rum. Though the wait was a bit longer than usual the food quality was worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Lamb Rumb, Winter pie and poutine with 2 points of Guinness

a3cTvvLpBJ6lzNF5GJDhgg.text: When I walked into the pub area, the waiter told me "are you sure you don't want to sit upstairs? The girls are better looking." Haha I had to sit down now because I was intrigued. So I ordered an apham England ale, scotch egg and Mac and cheese with cray fish. Honestly the beer was whatever, but super cheap! The scotch egg was perfectly cooked though and just fantastic. Well worth getting. The mac and cheese was also pretty good for the price. Overall the ambiance was a true English pub and I would recommend checking it out for some affordable drinking and food.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Scotch egg and Mac and cheese.
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Prices of beer, Mac and cheese and scotch egg

zWjQgiEQyy_ES2v14FjDvg.text: Very good. I had the fish of the day and the scotch egg. Both were delicious. My wife had the winter pie with cabbage. Very flavorful and filling. The cabbage was buttery and delicious. Great beer selection. Definitely recommend.

ToeHxjHrsK9wGRlA6AUN9g.text: I've dreamed of coming to London for as a long as I can remember. And as I arrived here at night, what better way to start a trip than at a proper English pub? So I spent a bit googling and yelping and found The Marquis. What a find. It's a nice and cozy pub with a Gastropub feel. I was promptly greeted by the bartender and sat. I ordered a pint and scotch egg firs. It was out of this world. I wanted to try more so I asked for a suggestion and the bt suggested the winter pie, so I went for it and it was out of this world. Hot, flavorful meat and a buttery flaky crust. Yum. I ended my night with a mulled cider and was on my way. A perfect first night in London!

O5KREoB7k3nYKgViuqXqew.text: Came for the scotch eggs which were pretty good but the rest of the meal was bland and unexciting -- the winter pie had a nice crust but the filling was too runny and lacked seasoning.  The upstairs dining room is not that pleasant -- there's a slightly off smell and the table was sticky.

ZEFuzg-2RAFZl1_4QXIsng.text: This review is only for their limited Bank Day (January 2nd) menu. This restaurant is divided up into 2 floors. The bottom floor is for just a bar and tables for people who are looking to have a drink. If you want to order food, you need to go up the stars to the 2nd floor. I had come here hoping to get a scotch egg because it was my last night in London haha but unfortunately because of their limited menu for Bank Day, they weren't able to make scotch eggs that day. I ended up getting fish and chips, and my bf wasn't hungry so he just got some soup (I forgot what kind it was). The fish and chips were pretty average, I've had better back in America. The soup was also okay, a little too creamy and kinda bland. I got a beer and my bf had some whiskey. Both were reasonably priced and decent. We also shared the sticky toffee for dessert, which was the right amount of sweetness and very good. I think the drinks and dessert was the best part of the meal.Maybe the restaurant is better when they have their full menu available, but I'm not sure how inclined I would be to return since London has so many pubs.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. fish and chips
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. sticky toffee

WlHSzvvI_zOb0bkGR_fcIQ.text: Ate my belly up after a whole day of walking! End up with the platter and separate scotch egg! Read it on one of the article that this place egg is different where it has red cabbage/herring filling in between! Amazing comfortable food won't bankrupt you! The location is off central London so may seem quiet in off hours!

nSoX1ipSA0jzU4Zp1BrJHg.text: We got off to a rough start with the waitress/hostess but the food was great so this review is based on the food. Started with a Scotch egg which was fantastic. I had a winter pie which was everything I was looking forward to for pub grub. Our kids had onion soup with crusty bread, my husband also had the winter pie. Great beer selection. Upstairs dining.

i_plDg7uR1JsS7-Bh-33yA.text: What's not to like? Friendly, helpful staff, cold beer and good food. On holiday from Cali - they took excellent care of us and made me feel at home in London!

yyURou0hQU9VZ9r4PaIsrA.text: Had a satisfactory meal here after a day of sightseeing. We didn't want to venture too far from our hotel and this was away from the Victoria Station.  Had to Marquis pie and mackerel rillet. Both were very good. The potato and leek soup was a bit bland but went well with the rillet's strong flavor. Decided to walk a bit for dessert so we didn't have it there. Nice staff and good overall ambiance.

ivxOxqptkiLZblElf2l8xA.text: This is a great pub to for authentic British food, and they also had some non-British items on the menu in case you don't want Bangers and Mash or Fish and Chips. I had their cheeseburger sliders, which were good but small portions (that was fine because I wanted a small meal). I also had their soup of the day, which was some sort of squash soup, and I really enjoyed it. It might be better to make a reservation here in advance because it was really busy when we came here on a Wednesday night. They were able to seat us, but we were kind of cramped into a small table by the window. This is a good place for tourists, but there were definitely some locals dining here too. To get to the restaurant area of the pub, you have to go upstairs.

bCjXndmpE77cjXiP0MArKA.text: The food was very good and so was the service.  However, the hostess was a bit snooty.  Overall, I'd come here again on my next visit and would recommend it to anyone in the area.

BF5Jp3b1Pk5ud9Xe9VtFlQ.text: Great spot for pub food. It's on the second floor and service is good. I really liked the scotch egg. It had great pork fat flavor and egg was cooked perfectly. Pan fried Hake was fresh and delicious. Soup was also very nice. The winter pot pie was good but had too much of a beefy flavor. It was very one sided. There were very few veggies in the pie. On the other hand the pot pie crust was amazing. Very buttery and crisp. Got one of their specialty ale but not my style. I'd go with one of their draughts.

oFMBG0Gmy4Mo_Vowc9dymA.text: Jolly good place for a drink indeed whilst your wife gets ready for dinner. I had a mulled cider followed by a specialty gin & tonic with cloves.

ZoV7SbHTFmZJItCCX29kyA.text: Best service we've had so far! Food and drinks are delicious! The mac n' cheese is excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom

nxQMgSXdrFoyZXaFBr1F7w.text: Big after-work watering hole. Delicious nibbles at the bar and (particularly in summer) a brilliant atmosphere.Love coming here withnfriemds.and colleagues. Much quieter at weekends but week nights it's busy till closing time

90v7rNLlOjWhWXvxfQa3GA.text: This was probably our go to place during our stay in London. It was conveniently situated next to our hotel. On our first night we braved the bar and it was just the English  experience I was looking for. Super friendly locals in a drunken stupor laughing and toasting to random celebratory events, imagined or real. The bar tenders were extremely friendly as well as the waiters.We were new to the scene and quite frankly overwhelmed. Our bar tender, sensing our amateur tastes in anything alcoholic really, suggested a pale ale, the "Aspall" of Suffolk. Of course, I had to let out a chuckle. But the moment the gargantuan sized glass was set in front of me, I was eager to sip the golden beverage. I sipped and instantly fell in love. How could a pale ale beer taste so delicious. It can be only described as subtle hints of citrus, the hops flavor not overpowering at all, it was light, and had a crisp, "clean" after taste. Imagine the beer version of 7up or Sprite, because that was exactly what it was.Along with our drinks, we chatted with locals and travelers alike and it was just a fantastic bar atmosphere drastically different from the US.As our stay in London came to an end, we ventured to try their brunch/lunch items. I ordered the Lamb Rump, and my goodness was it delicious. Travel tip: If you know your own country does something well, don't order that because subconsciously nothing will measure up, I mean it might, but that's a risk you're taking. Instead, order an item you know the country you're visiting will most likely execute perfectly. So lamb rump, red wine jus, and seasonal vegetables was an obvious choice. And, my theory was right. It was absolutely juicy, tender, seasoned beyond perfection and was the ultimate English comfort food I could've hoped for. If you want a friendly, fun, and delicious spot in London and you happen to be in this area, do yourself a favor and frequent this spot. It will have you longing for more!

IpchUSCWjZyGtNV_q7idOA.text: Ordered a burger rare, was told they only make them medium well.   No thanks. Ordered a ham and cheese sandwich on a roll.  Either my American teeth were too delicate to break through the crust or this damn thing was stale.   My dibs are on the latter.  The chips that it came with were old as well.  You can't mask an old potato taste. While we were there, someone else (British) ordered the same sandwich.  As we were leaving, I was curious to see if her British chompers were able to break through the bread.  Nope! Just as mine, roll tossed to the side.  Avoid at all costs unless your just looking for a beer.Edited to add a comment to the owners.  My American pallet isn't used to a "hamburger or hotdog roll" for my food.  Considering I ate at The Ledbury" the night before, you'd think I'd know the difference between a shit stale roll and a fresh one. Chip chip Cheerio!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. My incredibly stale roll!  Even the slight grill couldnt mask the stale flavor or texture.

dSkJB7SynIoGYht5wlMY0Q.text: Such a fun pub!  Really good food and an amazing array of gins!  Can't wait to go back to London just to go to this pub.  P.S. come during the week because they close pretty early on weekends.

r9vjtaQlgiXoz0VjvNMDUA.text: This was our first sit-down meal on our first night in London. I wish I could say that we chose this restaurant based on reviews alone, but honestly, we made this our dinner stop because it was close to the hotel and open kind of late. Hey, it was snowy, windy and cold that night, and we were absolutely exhausted, so don't judge!The bar downstairs was surprisingly packed when we walked in. I thought we weren't going to find a place to sit when my husband noticed a sign stating that the restaurant is upstairs. So, up the extremely steep, curved staircase we went and popped out in a cute and cozy dining room.We were given a table close to some windows, where we had a nice view of the snow swirling on the crazy fierce wind. We took a moment to review the menu (after ordering our first pints of Guinness, of course).I went with the Marquis Pie, and my husband ordered the fish and chips. We also got the basket of mixed bread to start, because yum. The mixed bread basket ended up being a few slices of toasted pita and two slices of a wheat bread served with butter. A bit pricey for what you're getting, but we had no trouble polishing the basket off.The pie was phenomenal. It came with a small side of buttered greens, served warm. It made me feel like I'd eaten some vegetables, which would balance out the beer, bread and meat pie. I loved the suet crust on the pie - it was flaky and crusty and paired with the pie's insides so well.My husband enjoyed his meal as well, though he did comment at one point that he should've ordered what I'd ordered. Still, the fish was fresh and they were generous with the cut. They didn't offer a whole lot of chips with his meal, which is usually fine as he's not much of a potato guy, but he was starving that night and hoped for a bit more to put in his face.Though we were full, and it was late at night, we decided to splurge on dessert. They had sticky toffee pudding on the menu, which of course I needed. The pudding was cylinder-shaped, served with a small scoop of ice cream and a container of salted caramel on the side. Seriously needed more of that caramel, but the dessert as a whole was delicious.We spent a couple hours holed up at our table, eating, drinking, drinking and eating. We watched the snow flurries, commented on people scurrying by on the street below, and talked ourselves out of ordering another pint or another dessert. This was a really good find for us, and made for a great start to our two week vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Caramel drizzle action shot
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Sticky Toffee Pudding
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Fish & Chips

C0OOBs8yuuM9E6rzri5pPg.text: So close to Victoria station and food was yumm! Someone recommended we try pub food while in London and we were very pleasantly surprised. My daughter got fish and chips which I've had in US but this was more flavorful. Nice surprise for London cuisine. Son had wings and enjoyed them. Hubby had vegetarian pie and he really liked it. He said he would def get that again. I had the lunch fish tatters sandwich and that was yummy. Highly recommend.  Only thing we didn't like was the "poutine". That was nothing like the poutine I've had in Montreal. This looked like fries with American cheese on top

c55zGOa7BcH50sqBux19bg.text: This will be a very short one star review. I called and asked what time they close as I was wanting dinner, I was told 12 pm when we arrived at 10:30 they said the kitchen was closed. I'm more than miffed!

7O7DQ0JRBor1CaZ_jUeqpw.text: We stopped in here on our first night in London. It is quite close to our hotel, and to be honest, it was the only pub we could find that we could get a seat at. Literally one table though. It was packed! Great food, great drinks, great service. We had a blast!! Definitely recommend if you are in the neighborhood.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Spinach and artichoke dip
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom

nYAy635ZcgbodwHTZLbzwA.text: Wound up here after getting kicked out of the more popular Cask Pub & Kitchen for the crime of dining with children.Charming, historic place with the dining room located upstairs. Kid-friendly with a kids' menu! Pleasant, enthusiastic service. Ale samples were offered and appreciated. Reasonable £4.50 each. Started with the Poutine, which was very good. Loved my first-ever beef & ale Winter Pie (£14.50), served with sauteed greens and cabbage. Very hearty after a day of walking around everywhere.

7sx2KajSlCYmzt5XxwhGzg.text: Very nice pub i'm glad i got to visit when i was in London. Best sticky toffee pudding i had when i was there and really satisfied my cravings for bangers and mash! Federica was the best! Can't wait to go back next time i go to London!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Bangers and Mash!

T1DUlEon-AppfS7bQcd3Ww.text: Located a few blocks from Victoria station, this is an interesting establishment. When you walk in, they have a casual bar. Upstairs is a nicer sit-down restaurant. And in the basement... well, my guess is a night club? I actually didn't go into the basement but when I looked down into their window, they had flashing strobe lights and loud blaring music so that's just my guess. Anyway, this review is for the restaurant experience. Service was great--the servers were very friendly and attentive to our needs. We didn't have to wait for a party of two on a Saturday night. Our orders came out pretty quickly.As for the food, it wasn't mind-blowing, but it was great comfort food. We had a scotch egg, sausage and mashed potatoes, and a sticky toffee pudding. The scotch egg was cooked perfectly--the yolk was slightly runny and the crust was crisp. The sausages were topped with sweet onions that gave a nice contrast to the savory sausages. It was my first time having toffee pudding and it seemed kind of rubbery, but I wonder if that's how it's supposed be. Overall, it's a good place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Scotch egg
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Sausage and mash
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Sticky toffee pudding with vanilla ice cream

UBEEwkSDRjpdYyXW2VBrvQ.text: We were very pleased with our Bev, Food and Service. It was hot upstairs but they let us open the window and things cooled down rapidly. Fish and chips are delicious here. My hubby and kiddos loved the bangers and mash. We had a great time chatting with the friendly staff and were offered some great walking suggestions for evening views along the Thames. Busy and popular spot after work hours, but the prices are right and the location is good too.

qVn3OjxhStUdsfe4R1Bneg.text: Great little pub. Total local vibe with great staff! Super friendly people and great food! Their Poutine Chips are beyond yummy! We ordered the fish and chips and were not disappointed at all! We did bring our toddler and they were very accommodating and sweet to her. She loved the sausage and smashed potatoes! Overall we had a fabulous meal in a fantastic little pub!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom

Wqca4cFDg2a7GQhc1bnQzg.text: Decor: cozy, standard pubService: warmFood: heartyHello London! If my gran were English yea, these would be her *stolen* recipes. Winter pie was crusty, beefy goodness. Lamb leg was saftig. Sticky toffee pudding was a revelation on a Sunday night. Next day: Fish and chips with mushy peas worth mention.

LvBLOggCPJLrDsNKG1K9UA.text: Decent pub just a short walk from the hotels surrounding Victoria Station.  Tried the sausage & mash on my first visit over and really enjoyed the flavors. Sausage is standard variety, but paired well with the gravy and red onions...mash was mash.

N-LOVagRFkBkFcfntmeQwg.text: Friendly servers, delicious food and of course, beer.  A local destination but visitors are made to feel welcome.  When in the UK, make sure you come here.

hW43V9_pc4lZnbwHWF_-kw.text: My family and I were in London for the first time in March. We had to do the traditional pub experience. Wasn't sure on the manners of bringing a 9 and 11 year old into a pub, so we did an early dinner at 4 just in case. Still did hear a patron note our children. However, staff was super friendly, beverages delicious, fish and chips perfect, scotch egg divine, and sticky toffee pudding was a dream!

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom

m2YyCEUQC2hKhdEDgvbpdA.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for a good place to grab a burger and a beer. And stumbled across this place. When we walked in we were greeted from what seemed like friendly service. Told to sit anywhere. So we did. 10 min went by without a single person acknowledging our existence. At this time another couple walked in. We greeted seated and handed menus immediately. And asked what they would like to order shortly after. I on the other hand had to grab a menu off the bar before anyone asked me anything. I don't know about you. But being ignored in a restaurant leaves a bad taste in my mouth. As for the food. I order the cheeseburger- Well prepared. Great tasteGF had chicken cheese sandwich- cheese was melted all over it. Looked good. She said it tasted good also. Some seasoning on the chicken she couldn't pin point.

46V1i3uguRJ8mZPjPOvvWA.text: I got to give this British pub a five star rating for drink, food, and pub-vibe.Cask beer was wonderful.  The wine pour damn generous! The scene was upbeat. Great location near Victoria Station..in Pimlico Village.Food- I ordered up the Mac & Cheese- multiple types of cheeses, parmesan, chucks of crayfish, and bits of bacon all baked into one delicious creation. Yum. Simonka was our server. She was such a pleasant, witty, and welcoming presence at the pub. What a gem! Thanks for the excellent service & awesome smile.  Simonka made our day! This pub is worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. The must try mac &  cheese!!
Photo of The Marquis of Westminster - London, United Kingdom. Great pub scene..

7IE7RulNMc9sK2tsrWGhwg.text: Decent pub food. Sunday roast was great although there were out of the rib eye steak....early on, we were seated around 5:30pm?!?  So, chicken instead. It was proper. The kids fish & chips was not  good. It was more like small frozen fish sticks you might get at the market. My daughter wished she order the adult version. Her most bogus meal or the entire two week trip. Service was a bit iffy and not really attentive.

SYJdEWGh0w1i4Fb6j9QNzg.text: We dubbed this face bar because the sign that hangs outside. The night crowd is the perfect amount of people. Got the cheese plate and it tasted excellent and very well portioned. Perfect for mid 20's to late 30's to grab a drink and bite to eat.

rTy8hTVczl_WfrMqyA5DuA.text: The Marquis does an excellent fish and chips and an equally good mussels and chips. The fries you get a some of the best I've ever tasted. The menu is a varied and interesting take on traditional pub grub and there's a good selection of drinks on offer at the bar. The staff are friendly chatty and the place has a lot of atmosphere. One of the best pubs in Pimlico IMO.
